revised_title: Graphical Register of Tides and Winds: A New Method for Measuring Tides and Winds
tldr: The author describes a new device for measuring tides and wind direction. The device uses a long sheet of paper with parallel lines representing feet in height, wound around a cylinder. A clock and a weather vane record hourly wind direction and tide levels, tracing lines on the paper. The author also discusses potential applications for tide prediction and the creation of accurate tide tables.
